body: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: Martin Golding

body: Common sense gets a lot of credit that belongs to cold feet.
author: Arthur Godfrey

body: Any fool can use a computer. Many do.
author: Ted Nelson

body: Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
author: Martin Luther King Junior

body: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

body: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

body: Every piece of software written today is likely going to infringe on someone else's patent.
author: Miguel de Icaza

body: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
author: Douglas Adams

body: I think we agree, the past is over.
author: George W. Bush

body: In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.
author: Coco Chanel

body: In the future everyone will be famous for fifteen minutes.
author: Andy Warhol

body: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

body: It is a mistake to think you can solve any major problems just with potatoes.
author: Douglas Adams

body: It's kind of fun to do the impossible.
author: Walt Disney

body: Java is to JavaScript what Car is to Carpet.
author: Chris Heilmann

body: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
author: Voltaire

body: Just don't create a file called -rf.
author: Larry Wall

body: Knowledge is power.
author: Francis Bacon

body: Let's call it an accidental feature.
author: Larry Wall

body: Linux is only free if your time has no value.
author: Jamie Zawinski

body: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

body: Never trust a computer you can't throw out a window.
author: Steve Wozniak

body: Nobody expects the Spanish inquisition.
author: Monty Python

body: On the Internet, nobody knows you're a dog.
author: Peter Steiner

body: One man's constant is another man's variable.
author: Alan J. Perlis

body: People that hate cats will come back as mice in their next life.
author: Faith Resnick

body: Perl - The only language that looks the same before and after RSA encryption.
author: Keith Bostic

body: PHP вЂ“ Yeah, you know me.
author: PHPaughty by PHPature

body: The future is here. It is just not evenly distributed yet.
author: William Gibson

body: The greatest performance improvement of all is when a system goes from not-working to working.
author: John Ousterhout

body: Software is like sex: It's better when it's free.
author: Linus Torvalds

body: Sour, sweet, bitter, pungent, all must be tasted.
author: Chinese Proverb

body: Stay hungry, stay foolish.
author: Whole Earth Catalog

body: The artist belongs to his work, not the work to the artist.
author: Novalis

body: The only "intuitive" interface is the nipple. After that it's all learned.
author: Bruce Ediger

body: The only completely consistent people are the dead.
author: Aldous Huxley

body: The problem with troubleshooting is that trouble shoots back.
author: Unknown Author

body: The three great virtues of a programmer: laziness, impatience, and hubris.
author: Larry Wall

body: Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.
author: Douglas Adams

body: When debugging, novices insert corrective code; experts remove defective code.
author: Richard Pattis

body: When in doubt, leave it out.
author: Joshua Bloch

body: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V Berard

body: We cannot learn without pain.
author: Aristotle

body: We have always been shameless about stealing great ideas.
author: Steve Jobs

body: You can kill a man but you can't kill an idea.
author: Medgar Evers

body: You can never underestimate the stupidity of the general public.
author: Scott Adams

body: You must have chaos in your soul to give birth to a dancing star.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

body: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty "text" file.
author: Louis Srygley

body: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday's code.
author: Dan Salomon

body: You miss 100 percent of the shots you never take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

body: One of the biggest problems that software developers face is that technology changes rapidly. It is very hard to stay current.
author: Vivek Wadhwa

body: Ideas want to be ugly.
author: Jason Santa Maria

body: One man's crappy software is another man's full time job.
author: Jessica Gaston

body: It's okay to figure out murder mysteries, but you shouldn't need to figure out code. You should be able to read it.
author: Steve McConnell

body: Programming languages, like pizzas, come in only two sizes: too big and too small.
author: Richard Pattis

body: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the universe is winning.
author: Rich Cook

body: Plan to throw one (implementation) away; you will, anyhow.
author: Fred Brooks

body: Perfection (in design) is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

body: Prolific programmers contribute to certain disaster.
author: Niklaus Wirth

body: Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however they should not be combined.
author: Kreitzberg and Shneiderman

body: It's better to wait for a productive programmer to become available than it is to wait for the first available programmer to become productive.
author: Steve McConnell

body: An organization that treats its programmers as morons will soon have programmers that are willing and able to act like morons only.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

body: Real programmers can write assembly code in any language.
author: Larry Wall

body: The key to performance is elegance, not battalions of special cases.
author: Jon Bentley, Doug McIlroy

body: Inside every large program, there is a program trying to get out.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

body: A good way to stay flexible is to write less code.
author: Pragmatic Programmer

body: No matter what the problem is, it's always a people problem.
author: Gerald M. Weinberg

body: Every big computing disaster has come from taking too many ideas and putting them in one place.
author: Gordon Bell

body: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later!
author: Fred Brooks

body: The best way to get a project done faster is to start sooner
author: Jim Highsmith

body: Even the best planning is not so omniscient as to get it right the first time.
author: Fred Brooks

body: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

body: Reality itself is too obvious to be true.
author: Jean Baudrillard

body: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

body: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.
author: Frederick Douglass

body: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
author: Albert Einstein

body: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.
author: Albert Einstein

body: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
author: Albert Einstein

body: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

body: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

body: When the solution is simple, God is answering.
author: Albert Einstein

body: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
author: Albert Einstein

body: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
author: Albert Einstein

body: It is a miracle that curiosity survives formal education.
author: Albert Einstein

body: I only believe in statistics that I doctored myself.
author: Winston S. Churchill?

body: Men and nations behave wisely when they have exhausted all other resources.
author: Abba Eban

body: Success is not forever and failure isn't fatal.
author: Don Shula

body: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
author: Mark Twain

body: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

body: Get your facts first, then you can distort them as you please.
author: Mark Twain

body: Apparently there is nothing that cannot happen today.
author: Mark Twain

body: Plans are worthless, but planning is everything.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

body: Before you marry a person you should first make them use a computer with slow Internet to see who they really are.
author: Will Ferrell

body: I just invent, then wait until man comes around to needing what I've invented.
author: R. Buckminster Fuller

body: The best way to make your dreams come true is to wake up.
author: Muriel Siebert

body: If you can't write it down in English, you can't code it.
author: Peter Halpern

body: Suspicion is healthy. It'll keep you alive.
author: Laurell K. Hamilton

body: If your parents never had children, chances are you won't, either.
author: Dick Cavett

body: Sometimes I think we're alone in the universe & sometimes I think we're not. In either case the idea is quite staggering
author: Arthur C. Clarke

body: Talk is cheap, show me the code!
author: Linus Torvalds
